phasing_details.phase_detail: See supporting statement for details - proposed development dates will vary dependent on legislated election dates

open_spaces_details.description: Temporary loss of public open space only during election counts. Returned to a public park area outside of those times.

subdivision_of_building: Triangular section of land within Walpole Park as indicated on location map and Appendix 1 (Plan 1 - marquee site)
decision_conditions: Time Compliance.
1. Development shall commence no later than 3 years following the date of grant of this permission.
Reason: To comply with s91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.
Temporary Permission
2. The use hereby permitted shall be discontinued and as necessary, any buildings removed on or before 5 years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To secure satisfactory cessation of use in accordance with the terms of the submitted application.
3.Approved Plans and Supporting Documents/Reports
Drawings
WP010 - Proposed site layout
WP012RevA - Proposed Site Location
WP025RevA- Roof Plan
WP026RevB - Floor Plan and Elevation
WP027RevA - Sections
WP028RevA - Roof Plan
WP029RevA - Floor Plan
WP030RevB - Elevations
WP031RevA - Section Plan
WP032RevA - Roof Plan All Marquees
Reports
Electoral Services Planning Statement Walpole Park 2023, including Appendices 1 - 17
Information in respect of alternative sites assessment and response to consultees, 10th January 2024
Preliminary Ecological Appraisal by Temple Group Ltd.
Design and Access Statement by Alan Baxter Ltd.
Heritage Statement by Alan Baxter Ltd.
Ealing Council Parks Supporting Statement
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt.
Development in accordance with Approved Plans
4. The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the approved plans and reports listed in condition 3 above.
Reason: In the interests of the character and appearance of the area, the enjoyment of Walpole Park and the residential amenities of nearby occupiers.
Erection and derigging/dismantling of marquees

5. A. The erection and derigging/dismantling of marquees and associated structures, security fencing, CCTV, lighting and other measures shall all take place only within the application site edged red on Proposed Site Plan WP010 and in accordance with the order of working set out in the Electoral Services Planning Statement Walpole Park 2023 Sections:
- 1 (General information provided by London Borough of Ealing on the election verification and count),
-6 (Power and Lighting),
-7 (Sound system for public announcements) and
-Appendix 3 (Lighting and heating plans plus visual examples of perimeter lighting).

B. The permitted hours of erection and derigging/dismantling of marquees and associated structures and security fencing is restricted to 0800-1700 Mondays to Fridays and 0930-1530 on Saturdays. No working shall take place on Sundays, Bank or Public Holidays.

C. For the avoidance of doubt, the following are not subject to these hours of working restrictions: assembling, disassembling and collection of election count furniture, ICT, CCTV, lighting and power testing equipment (excluding emergency generator testing), staff training and polling day counts and verification.
Reason: In the interests of the character and appearance of the area, the enjoyment of Walpole Park and the residential amenities of nearby occupiers.
Delivery and Dismantling

6. Delivery, collection/derigging, dismantling and removal of the development shall be carried out on each occasion of the use of the application site for election counts and shall be operated strictly in accordance with the Electoral Services Planning Statement Walpole Park 2023:
- Section 3 (Transport Statement),
-Appendix 8 (Plan showing Articulated Vehicle Routes) and
-Appendix 9 (Plan Showing Vehicle Routes within the Park)
and shall be maintained as such thereafter. No change therefrom shall take place without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.
Reason: In the interests of the character and appearance of the area, the enjoyment of Walpole Park and the residential amenities of nearby occupiers.

7. No delivery, collection/derigging, dismantling and removal of the development shall be carried out on each occasion of the use of the application site for election counts until the vehicle trackway installation has been laid strictly in accordance with the Electoral Services Planning Statement Walpole Park 2023:
- Section5 (Marquees),
-Appendix 1 (Plan showing marquee structures and ancillary services) and
- Appendix11 (Marquee profiles, specs, accreditation and general health and safety information).

The trackway shall be maintained in situ and to the satisfaction of the local planning authority, until it is removed following the process of delivery, collection/derigging or dismantling on each occasion. No change therefrom shall take place without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.
Reason: In the interests of safeguarding the condition and appearance of Walpole Park.
Emergency Generator and/or Plant

8. All new mobile installed diesel generators must comply with a minimum NOx emissions standard of 150mg/Nm-3 (at 5% O2) approved by an accredited laboratory, with emissions concentrations expressed at specific reference conditions for temperature, pressure, oxygen and moisture content under normal operating condition in accordance with the 2018 Non-Road Mobile Machinery (NRMM) Emissions Regulations.

Where any combustion plant does not meet the relevant standard, it should not be operated without the fitting of suitable NOx abatement equipment or technology. Evidence of installation shall be required where secondary abatement is required to meet the NOx Emission standard 150mg/Nm-3 (at 5% O2).

The emergency plant and generators hereby permitted may be operated only when required in an emergency situation or for essential testing, which should not be in the presence of the general public or other sensitive receptors and when the air quality forecast is Low.

Reason: To ensure the development meets its obligations to deliver air quality objectives for NO2 in accordance with London Local Air Quality Management (LLAQM), and to limit PM2.5 (fine particulates) to safeguard public health and well-being and external amenity of nearby sensitive receptors.
External noise from machine or equipment

9. The rating level (LAr,Tr) of the individual and combined maximum noise emitted by any plant, ducting and equipment on the site shall be lower than the existing background sound level by at least 10dBA, as measured at/ calculated to the nearest and most affected noise sensitive premises. The plant noise level at non-residential noise sensitive premises at or adjacent to the development site shall achieve the criteria of BS 8233:2014, where any assessment shall be made in accordance with BS4142:2014 +A1 2019, with all machinery operating together at maximum capacity.
Reason:   To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development and surrounding noise sensitive receptors are not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations and equipment.
Tree Protection - Monitoring

10. Prior to the commencement of development on each occasion of the use of the application site for election counts, the location of security fencing and arrangement of barriers to protect trees within the site shall be agreed on site with Trees and/or Parks and Leisure Officers. The barriers shall be erected prior to the erection and dismantling/derigging of marquees and associated works and shall be retained until those works are completed.
Reason: In order to safeguard trees considered to be worthy of retention in the interests of visual amenity.
Security

11. The counter terrorism security measures agreed in consultation with the Metropolitan Police Designing Out Crime Officer (DOCO) and Counter Terrorism Security Advisor (CTSA) and incorporated into the development shall be carried out and maintained for the first and each subsequent use for the duration of this permission, in accordance with those agreed details and any finally agreed details, prior to the site becoming fully operational.  No change therefrom shall take place without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.
Reason: In the interests of the safety and security of the permitted use of the site. Note: For this reason this information will not be shared in the public domain.
Refuse Storage

12. Prior to occupation on each occasion for election counts, provision for refuse and recycling storage as set out in the Electoral Services Planning Statement Walpole Park 2023 Section 1j) Site waste management, shall be laid out in accordance with the approved drawings and details and shall not be obstructed or used for any other purpose.
Reason: In the interests of providing adequate disposal, storage and collection of waste and recycling.
description:
Erection for a period of 5 years of temporary marquees and associated works required at times for the purpose of carrying out Election counts for Local, Mayoral, Greater London Assembly, Parliamentary and other National Referenda. Site to be cleared and returned to public park use outside of those times. (Regulation 3 Application by London Borough of Ealing).
The proposals comprise an application by the London Borough of Ealing likely to affect the character, appearance or setting of heritage assets, including of a Conservation Area and Registered Park and Garden.
